title: Breakthrough technology transforms waste plastic bottles into polymers for lithium-ion batteries - EurekAlert

Reducing Scope 3 emissions requires organizations to tackle big challenges boldly, through the lens of value creation and with the involvement of the entire organization.

title: Navien announces first HVAC product during virtual launch event - Supply House Times
summary: Navien announced three new innovations during a virtual launch event: the NPF Hydro-furnace, their first HVAC product; the NHW-A non-condensing tankless water heater, and the NHB-H condensing boiler. The NPF Hydro-furnace is a high-efficiency furnace that uses Navien's industry-proven dual stainless steel heat exchangers to heat water in an isolated compartment out of the airstream. The NHW-A non-condensing tankless water heater features the patented ComfortFlow recirculation pump and buffer tank originally introduced in the NPE-A condensing tankless water heater. The NHB-H condensing boiler is an update to the widely popular NHB, and includes new advancements such as the Vent Installation Detector (VID) for enhanced safety and an advanced front panel controller with an intuitive multi-line LCD display.
green_innovation: TRUE - Navien's NPF Hydro-furnace is a high-efficiency furnace that uses Navien's industry-proven dual stainless steel heat exchangers to heat water in an isolated compartment out of the airstream, which provides sound-reduction and energy efficiency.

title: Lessons from Energy Crisis Due to the War in Ukraine | BCG - BCG
summary: The EU has managed to remain resilient through the first year of the war in Ukraine by investing in diversification of energy, keeping energy policy and strategy agile, enhancing energy security, and promoting energy efficiency.  The energy crisis has underscored the fact that energy will play a major geopolitical role and that further energy disruptions are likely to occur, making it imperative for policymakers, energy producers, and consumers to learn from the lessons of the past year.  Actions taken by EU governments to reduce reliance on Russian natural gas included spending massively to acquire LNG on spot markets, leasing FSRUs, and restarting idle coal-fired power plants. These choices came at an environmental cost, with nations returning to coal and diesel-fueled power generation, and illustrate the often-hard tradeoffs that governments make between energy security and sustainability.  The EU's bold policy combined conservation, massive investment to diversify energy sources, and a willingness to temporarily veer from decades of energy strategy to tackle the crisis at hand. However, EU countries emerged from the winter of 2022–2023 with natural gas storage levels at their highest level in years, fuel prices back down to pre-invasion levels,1 1 Gas prices have, as of mid-August 2023, jumped again on the potential for strikes at Australian LNG export facilities. A strike could put 10% of global LNG supplies at risk. Notes: 1 Gas prices have, as of mid-August 2023, jumped again on the potential for strikes at Australian LNG export facilities. A strike could put 10% of global LNG supplies at risk. and an economic hit that was lighter than anticipated.

title: How yachts are disposed of – and why it's so environmentally toxic - Yachting Monthly
summary: The marine industry is facing a growing problem of how to dispose of redundant, environmentally toxic GRP-built craft. There are currently 6 million boats in the EU, 95% of which are made of GRP. Each year, 1-2% reach the end of their usable life, but only 2,000-3,000 are properly recycled. France's APER scheme is a world first which requires French manufacturers to pay an ‘eco-contribution’ for every new boat sold. That money is then supplemented by contributions from the national annual taxation on recreational craft, giving the scheme an operating budget to deal with recycling the legacy fleet, partially funded by the new fleet.
green_innovation: TRUE, The article describes the urgent need to find solutions to the problem of recycling materials from the legacy fleet of GRP-built craft and the steps being taken to design new boats using recyclable and bio-based materials that can be regrown on an annual basis and have low global warming potential.

EPR works on the simple premise that the original manufacturer retains responsibility for the item when it reaches its EOL.

title: Designing super-fast trimodal sponges using recycled polypropylene for organics cleanup | Scientific Reports - Nature.com
summary: This article describes a new method of creating porous polymer thin films that can be used to selectively sorb oil from water. They are also reusable and can be recycled using both mechanical squeezing and solvent washing techniques.

title: Seizing the Opportunity of E-Waste Recycling | BCG - BCG
summary: The current e-waste recycling system faces challenges, including minimal landfill bans, varied and limited recycling programs, expensive logistics relative to recovered value, sparse or infrequent collection in rural areas, and limited consumer awareness. Exporting, insufficient domestic processing capacity, and commodity price volatility are additional obstacles. Steps to improve the situation include legislation/regulation to mandate recycling and penalize exports, public-private partnerships to facilitate responsible recycling, incentives for collection and recycling, upgrading separation/refining technology, establishing a domestic recycling network, adopting circularity-by-design principles to make products more durable and easier to repair/recycle, and implementing everything-as-a-service business models.

title: The future of materials - Deloitte
